description: Dig It! is a treasure-hunting game. You're Jim, a pudgy shovel enthusiast, and you're digging up the Lost Treasures of an alien prospector named Zeke! Travel across sand, earth, grass, and stony plains, searching for the elusive yet precious booty! Use your Shovel Sensor to get near treasure, then DIG, DIG, DIG! There are also shovel and time powerups hidden to help you on your quest! It's a race against time.

sample_screenshots.caption: Time for Baldotron to start diggin!
Digging into rock is a little difficult

title: Dig It!

description: Jewels and Jim is an action-puzzle game. In it, you play Jim, a guy trying to retrieve stolen gems. You must collect all the gems on the screen. Once you do, Jewel Walls disappear, giving access to other areas. To get off the level, you must get a key and unlock the exit door. Hindering your progress in your quest are the evil Gloobs, the green Aliens that stole all the jewels! The game has 99 different levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Flip the switch and reveal the key

title: Jewels and Jim

description:
NBC Sports National Heads-Up Poker Championship brings the annual poker competition broadcast on NBC to the mobile phone.

From the main menu, you can choose to play any of the three modes: Heads-up Tournament (where winner takes all in first 5 games of single elimination, with the Final Championship best two out of three), Heads-up Single Match (one game against a single opponent of your choice from among the six available), and Texas Hold’em Showdown (play on a table with all six opponents at once in this winner takes all Hold’em side game).

After you choose the mode you’d like to play and enter your name, an NBC announcer will explain the game and introduce you to your opponent(s). You then see the Heads-Up modes from a first-person perspective, seated across the table from your opponent. For Hold’em gameplay, the camera looks down on the table with you and your six opponents seated around it. All gameplay can be done using the directional pad, the select key, and the back key. Press the # key at any time to bring up the Pause Menu for help topics. Press the * key for settings in the Options menu. Gameplay in each round proceeds as follows: blinds are placed at the start of each game; two cards are dealt to each player face down; players may call, raise or fold; three community cards (useable by all players) are dealt face up in the middle of the table (The Flop); a second betting round takes place; a fourth community card is dealt face up (The Turn); a third betting round takes place; a fifth and final community card is dealt face up (The River); the final betting round takes place; and, finally, remaining players compare hands to determine the winner for that round.

The game also includes SMS options for playing a trivia game, receiving poker tips, and getting news about the actual NHPC event on your mobile phone.
title: NBC Sports National Heads-Up Poker Championship

description: 3D Battle Tank is a first-person vector graphics tank game, based loosely on the classic Atari arcade game Battlezone. Each level is filled with random geometric obstacles, and introduces more and/or more sophisticated enemies, including regular tanks (green), faster and more aggressive "super tanks" (purple), UFOs which are harmless, but worth bonus points, and ballistic missiles -- both straight-shooting and zig-zagging. Along with sound effects, phone vibration feedback is available on many handsets.
title: 3D Battle Tank

description:
Jail break in progress! A slew of convicts have escaped from prison, and its your job to round them all up and return them to jail as fast as you can. Along with your trusty deputy, you navigate each of the 28 challenging levels, grabbing power-ups, avoiding treacherous terrain, and dodging speeding cars while you track down prisoners around the world. Chase felons through training grounds, forest mazes, rocky deserts, grassy suburbs, interstates with heavy traffic, island scenes, and mountain terrain.

Jail Trail is a unique 2-D top-down action game specifically designed for easy control on cell phones. Loosely based on the extremely popular "Snake" cell phone game, the lead cop and his deputy constantly moving, and you use the the arrow buttons to turn head of the "trail" or "chain", tracking down the fleeing convicts. When you catch up to an escaped felon running from the cops, he is cuffed and attached to the end of the chain. All deputies and convicts attached to the chain will follow the lead cop, and you have to make sure you don't run into any of the varied obstacles or any of the felons in the chain itself. If you hit an obstacle or the chain, you'll be stunned for a few seconds and some of the convicts will escape and you'll have to track them down again.

There are different types of convicts, each with their own unique abilities and AI, and the game includes many power-ups such as "Freeze All", "Invincibility", "Stun Gun", and even bonus point "Donuts". You can unlock new levels as you advance through the game and can start a new game from any unlocked level, so you don't need to start from the beginning every time. The game also saves high scores, best times for each level, unlocked levels, and one saved game.
title: Jail Trail

description: In this mobile puzzle/action game, players are tasked with matching colored blocks together to form bigger clusters. Once linked, clusters can be destroyed using a diamond piece that will randomly appear. If players can bring down their tower of colored gems before time runs out, they win. In addition to the single-player modes (Classic, Action, Puzzle), players can also play against opponents in real-time, in an online multiplayer mode. Once again tasked with clearing stacks of colored bocks by dropping diamonds, players race against their online opponent to clutter the opposing screen with the blocks that they have cleared. If a player's screen screen fills up to the top with gems, the match is over.
title: Blingster Battle

description:
BioShock for mobile phones was released in two versions. First a 2D top down game and then this 3D first person adaptation for more advanced phones.

The year is 1960 and the player character, Jack, is on board a plane crossing the Atlantic ocean. Things go wrong though and the plane crashes. Jack is lucky though and finds himself outside a lighthouse. This is no ordinary lighthouse however. It leads to Rapture, an Utopian underwater city built by the tycoon Andrew Ryan. It's not long until Jack is contacted by a man called Atlas who offers Jack his support.

Gameplay remains the same as the original 2K shooter. Not only does it tell the same story, it also comes with many of its gameplay mechanics. Like in any other shooter the player can use numerous weapons, both melee and ranged. In BioShock the player also has access to plasmids which are special powers like electric bolts and fireballs. Rapture is full of splicers, insane people damaged by severe use of plasmids. These are the most common enemies in the game and comes in different shapes such as thuggish splicers that use melee weapons and leadhead splicers that are armed.

The player will also come across Big Daddies and Little Sisters. The sisters role in Rapture is to collect ADAM from corpses. ADAM is needed by the player to buy new plasmids. To get ADAM the player needs to gather it from a sister. This is not so easy since each sister is protected by a big daddy which has to be defeated in battle. Once the big daddy is defeated the player can choose to either kill the sister and get a large amount of ADAM or save her to get a smaller amount. For every three saved sisters the player will get a gift as compensation.

This version does however only feature the first four levels of the original game, namely: Welcome to Rapture, Medical Pavilion, Neptune’s Bounty and Smuggler’s Hideout. It features five weapons from the original: the wrench, the pistol, the machine gun, the shotgun and the grenade launcher.
title: BioShock

description: Duke Nukem Arena is an updated release of first-person shooter Duke Nukem Mobile 3D. It contains the 21 levels of that original game as a whole, but updated with three difficulty levels. Entirely new is the Nukem Dead survival mode where the Duke needs to survive many waves of enemies after each other. The third part to this release is a wireless multiplayer free-for-all multiplayer mode for up to four players. Choosing from three characters such as Duke, Pig Cop and Paratrooper, human players go head to head in different arenas.
title: Duke Nukem Arena

description:
The Madden football series comes to mobile phones for the first time with Madden NFL 06. The game offers 3D graphics with players as 2D bitmaps, and a sampling of modes and features seen on other platforms.

Players can play exhibition games or a full season. Any match during a season can be played or simulated, and it is also possible to skip right to the playoffs. There are options for player trades as well as substitutions between quarters. Quarter length can be set between one and five minutes, and the game features John Madden play-by-play commentary.
title: Madden NFL 06

description:
Need for Speed: Most Wanted for mobile phones is based on the console game of the same name. It features the same general storyline and setting as that version, with some of the same live-action cutscenes also included. Regarding gameplay it is however adapted to the limited hardware capabilites: featuring simpler 3D graphics, no free-roaming, and completely different racing modes.

Playing as a newbie street racer in Rockport City, the player's goal is to move up the so-called Blacklist, a ranking of the street racing elite. Three different types of races are available: Outrun races pit the player against the clock and against a phalanx of police vehicles giving chase. In Speed Camera races, the goal is to hit speed camera positions on the track with maximum speed, with the average speed having to be higher than a set goal necessary to win. Finally, Boss Outrun races are duels against the Blacklist drivers, with the player gaining the opponent's car upon winning. There are sixteen cars in the game in total. Completing races as well as driving dangerously earns money which can be spent to upgrade the cars.

A lot of the game content like videos and music tracks is optional and only streamed to the phone via the VCast service if necessary. The game controls allow for either automatic or manual acceleration.
title: Need for Speed: Most Wanted

description:
Kingdom Hearts is a mobile spin-off of the Kingdom Hearts series released exclusively through Verizon's V CAST service. In the game you play as Sora, who wakes up on a deserted island with his friends nowhere to be found. He travels through four different worlds on his quest to find his missing friends, including worlds based on Disney's Alice in Wonderland, Aladdin, and Sleeping Beauty.

The game plays similarly to other games in the series, however due to the limitations of mobile phones at the time the game makes use of tank controls for controlling Sora. You must use your keyblade and magic spells you find as you fight your way through each level.
title: Kingdom Hearts

description:
NBA Live 06 is the debut of EA's basketball series on mobile phones. The game features licensed teams and players, 3D graphics, and, unlike earlier mobile simulations of the sport, has full 5-on-5 teams.

Game modes include Quick Play for a random game, Play Now for a single game with selectable teams, and Season for a 16-game season plus eventual playoffs. On offense, the controls allow for shooting, passing (the player passed to can't be chosen) and dunking (with the phone vibrating on a successful dunk). On defense, it is possible to switch between a number of defensive sets, and the defender can attempt steals and blocks. The game features commentary by Marv Albert.
title: NBA Live 06
FIFA World Cup: On the Break
The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King

description: Wild River is a very simple action game starring Aulbath from Darkstalkers: The Night Warriors. Players through water mazes from an overhead view perspective, dodging enemies and avoiding obstacles while trying to make their way to the end.
title: Aulbath: Wild River
